title: Dow falls more than 200 points as Trump says he's not ready to strike a China tariff deal
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average added to modest losses Friday morning after President Donald Trump suggested that a trade resolution with China wasn't imminent. The Dow  was down 224 points, or 0.9%, at 26,143, the S&P 500 index  slipped 1% to 2,909, while the Nasdaq Composite Index  was down 1.3% at 7,938, in morning trade.

title: Asian shares edge up, but renewed trade jitters cap gains
